title: 107_s1210
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE." is a concise statement indicating the beginning of a section with a short title. The "Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2002" reauthorizes the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996, extending block grants, federal guarantees, training, and technical assistance until 2007. It also amends the Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund. The Indian Housing Loan Guarantee Fund under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1992 is amended to cover fiscal years 1997 through 2007. SEC. 3 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 defines 'housing related community development' as tribally-owned facilities that aid in reservation housing construction. It excludes activities under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act. SEC. 4 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 amends Section 101(h) to include comprehensive housing and community development planning activities. SEC. 5 addresses the treatment of program income and labor standards. SEC. 5 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 amends Section 104 regarding the treatment of program income and labor standards. It includes provisions for utilizing income for housing-related activities and monitoring the expenditure of retained program income. SEC. 7 amends Section 601 of the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 to include housing related community development activities. SEC. 8 adds a community development demonstration project to Section 202 of the Act. The Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act of 1996 is amended to include a community development demonstration project for Indian tribes to use funds for designing and operating community projects. The Secretary will submit a study to Congress on the feasibility of establishing a demonstration project for Indian tribes to receive assistance in Federal housing funding while maximizing tribal authority and decision-making. SEC. 9. BLACK MOLD INFESTATION STUDY. The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development must complete a study on black mold infestation in Native American housing within 180 days of this Act and submit recommendations to Congress.
